poem:
### Transparency

A coin, thrice-washed
in shadows' streams,
slips into honored palms.
A face, too polished
to reflect truth,
questions murk in daylight.
Honest gazes blend
with fabric-draped intents—
a man emerges,
a path concealed beneath.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Robert Jenrick faces more funding questions after donor comes forward Robert Jenrick is facing further questions about donations totalling £75,000 to his Conservative leadership campaign from a firm that was loaned money via a tax haven, after a businessman revealed himself to be the ultimate source of the funding. Jenrick, the former immigration minister, has been criticised over the transparency of his funding after it emerged that the campaign donation came from a company that". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
